body: :+1: It will be good, if we'll use this on OpenRA.

Have you contacted the author to make sure we can indeed use his resource? (assuming the license doesn't already say so.)

On 2015-02-11, at 11:07 AM, Taryn Hill notifications@github.com wrote:

> The popular RA2 mod Mental Omega gives spys a special insignia that denote that the actor is:
> a) A spy
> b) An allied unit (or owned by you)
> 
> This insignia is not visible to enemies and cannot be 'discovered' even if the disguise is discovered.
> 
> Screenshot
> 
> Â\
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.
I'd only ask if you had it already coded + planned on using their art, if this is going to happen.
I don't think we should use the art from MO.
Opening again because support for this has been added, but a decoration is still missing.

As requested on IRC (http://logs.openra.net/?year=2015&month=05&day=23#16:06:09), here are some possible symbols:

![7466_2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/7785126/12629f90-0182-11e5-82a2-229b411790bd.png)

And here are 4 and 9 (rgb non-indexed PNG files, if someone wants to convert them to shp):
![star7466](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/7785132/238ada94-0182-11e5-8ca1-9f7dc98bb62e.png)

![eye7466](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/7785130/1fb5d310-0182-11e5-92e0-e523939ac333.png)
Now that #8478 is merged for spies, is there a plan to add a symbol (a star: see my previous message) for allied/friendly units?

That star was used for hero identification in MO (practically Tanya/Commandoes had it). I don't know if we're interested in such.

It probably should be it's own issue anyway.
I like the idea for hero units. Added it to the checklist at #7551.
